sentences.sentence_english: His life was the same as before.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áx̱ goot ḵu.aa áx̱ goot ḵu.aa wé yatseeneit du shát.
sentences.sentence_english: But she’d come to him, but she’d come to him, that brown bear, his wife.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aadé óosh gé ng̱wateeyi yé gé chʼu mistake l yoo oosneigi kát wé shaawát x̱á.
sentences.sentence_english: How would it have been if the woman hadn’t made the mistake, you see.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: “Héidu jáʼ!” yóo ash yawsiḵaa “De koodzí kwshé yóo gé yakʼwudzix̱aawu át awsiteen gé.” (Chʼa aadé yéi x̱at x̱ʼakg̱ee.oo.) Yóo áwé ash yawsiḵaa “Daadzix̱áawu át awsiteen,” yóo áwé ash daayaḵá x̱á.
sentences.sentence_english: “Hey there, my dear,” she said to him, “Isn’t it magnificent to see a tiny face with hair on it?” (Please excuse my language.) This is what she said to him, “To see a thing with hair on it,” is what she said to him, you see.

lines.line_tlingit: “De koodzí kwshé yóo gé yakʼwudzix̱aawu át awsiteen gé.”

is what she said to him, you see.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tlél áx̱ x̱ʼeitaan.
sentences.sentence_english: He wouldn’t speak to her.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áyá yá aadé ash yawsiḵaayi yéich áwé át x̱ʼeiwatán.
sentences.sentence_english: It was because she said this to him that he spoke to her.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yú yanshukát du yátxʼi wé xóots ḵu.aa de s dligéixʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: But on the beach his bear children were fully grown.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: “Yijáḵ yee éesh yijáḵ.” Tsaa, tle anax̱ yeiḵ has lugúḵch sagú wéitʼát.
sentences.sentence_english: “Kill your father. Kill him.” Pleased with the seals, the children would come running down to the beach.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aag̱áa áwé áwé altín yú ḵʼatx̱áan ḵa yú goox̱ kooḵénaa áwé ḵʼatx̱áan s altín.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yéi áwé kdulneek du x̱ʼéidáx̱. Du guk.ádi du gúgu yú.á wé shaawát du wootsaag̱áyi; yées ḵáa áwé at doogú xʼóow áwé awdlisík.
sentences.sentence_english: That’s how it’s told from his words. It’s said there were earrings on the ears of the woman, she had a cane; she was a young person, she wore an animal skin on her back tied around her waist.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yakawjixít, ách áwé a yáx̱ has yakashxeet Teiḵweidí.
sentences.sentence_english: She had painted her face, this is why the Teiḵweidí paint their faces like her.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Lingít áwé yú.á.
sentences.sentence_english: She was human, they say.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A x̱ánt hán du x̱úx̱ wé át lingít áwé sdu waḵshiyeexʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: But the animal wife stood by her husband’s body, she was a human in their eyes.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ashí wé shí wé Teiḵweidích has ashée nuch.
sentences.sentence_english: She sang the cry sung by the Teiḵweidí.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Kichx̱áandáx̱ aa sdu dayéen ashí.
sentences.sentence_english: The one from Ketchikan, she sang to them.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Xóots x̱ʼasheeyí.
sentences.sentence_english: The Brown Bear Song.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A kát g̱áax̱! A kát g̱áax̱. Aadáx̱ has awlikʼúts a jíni.
sentences.sentence_english: She cried to it! She cried to it. They had torn his arms off.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: G̱aax̱ kíknáx̱ áwé aadé altsóow yá a daasheeyí wé du x̱úx̱ g̱aax̱ kíknáx̱.
sentences.sentence_english: She joined them back to his body while singing this cry for her husband, while singing this cry.
